head.title: The Gift of Life, Even at the End

hedline.hl1: The Gift of Life, Even at the End

abstract.p: Dr Morton D Bogdonoff letter on Dr David A Shaywitz's Dept 19 Op-Ed comment on death and dying; points out that being awakened at 4AM to care for very ill patient is part of being an attending doctor (S)

block.p: Although David A. Shaywitz (Op-Ed, Sept. 19) emphasizes his uncle's doctor's dismissal of the possibility of additional months of life of a good quality, what is even more distressing is that the patient's wife sensed that the attending doctor was irritated when she called him at 4 a.m. to report a high fever.

Although David A. Shaywitz (Op-Ed, Sept. 19) emphasizes his uncle's doctor's dismissal of the possibility of additional months of life of a good quality, what is even more distressing is that the patient's wife sensed that the attending doctor was irritated when she called him at 4 a.m. to report a high fever.

Being awakened at such an hour is part of being a doctor, and such irritation warrants censure by the chief of his department. Such supervision, rarely exercised these days, might have a chastening effect on many staff doctors who forget their professional oaths and responsibilities.
MORTON D. BOGDONOFF, M.D. New York, Sept. 19, 2000
The writer is emeritus professor of medicine, Weill Medical College of Cornell University.
